see also 1, first sentence.

1. Xarufa, (Ṣ, O, Mṣb, Ḳ,) aor. _u {yaXorufu}, (Ḳ,) inf. n. XarafN (Ṣ,* O,* Mṣb,* Ḳ, TA) and XaraAfapN, (TA,) said of a man, (Ṣ, O, TA,) He was, or became, high, elevated, exalted, or eminent, (Ṣ, O, Mṣb, Ḳ, TA,) [in rank, condition, or estimation,] in respect of religion or of worldly things: (Ḳ, TA:) [generally meaning he was high-born, or noble:] part. n. XariyfN [q. v.]. (Ṣ, O, Mṣb, Ḳ, TA.) [See also XarafN, below.]
[Hence one says,] Xarufato nafosuhu Eani AlX-aIoCi His soul was above the thing; disdained, or scorned, it. (L in art. Anf.)

Xarafati Aln-aAqapu, and Xarufat, (O, Ḳ,) aor. of each _u, inf. n. XuruwfN, (Ḳ,) reg. as of the former verb, and irreg. as of the latter, (TA,) The she-camel was, or became, such as is termed XaArifN [q. v.]. (O, Ḳ.)

Xarafahu, aor. _u {yaXorufu}, (IJ, Ṣ, O, Ḳ, TA,) inf. n. XarofN, (TA,) He overcame him, or surpassed him, in Xaraf [i. e. highness, elevation, or eminence, of rank, condition, or estimation; or nobility]; (IJ, Ṣ, O, Ḳ, TA;) and so Xarufa Ealayohi: (Z, TA:) or he excelled him (TaAlahu, Ḳ, TA, in the CK [erroneously] TAwalahu,) in the grounds of pretension to respect or honour (fiI AlHasabi). (Ḳ, TA.) See 3.
Xarafa AlHaAYiTa, (Ḳ, TA,) aor. _u {yaXorufu}, inf. n. XarofN, (TA,) He put to the wall a Xurofap [q. v.]. (Ḳ, TA.) [See also 2.]

Xarifati AlOucunu, and Xarifa Almanokibu, aor. _a {yaXorafu}, (Ḳ, TA,) inf. n. XarafN, (TA,) The ear, and in like manner the shoulder, was, or became, high, (Ḳ, TA,) and prominent: or, as some say, stood up. (TA.)
And Xarifa, [from XarafN signifying the “hump” of a camel,] (O, Ḳ,) said of a man, (O,) He kept constantly, or continually, to the eating of the [camel's] hump. (O, Ḳ.)

entry.sense: 2. Xr-fhu, inf. n. taXoriyfN, He (God) rendered him high, elevated, exalted, or eminent, [in rank, condition, or estimation; or ennobled him:] (Ṣ, KL,* PṢ:*) and he held him, or esteemed him, to be so. (MA, PṢ.) ISd thinks that the verb may also mean He regarded with more, or exceeding, honour. (TA.) [And Golius explains it as meaning He decked with a royal garment; on the authority of the KL; in my copy of which I find no other meaning assigned to it than the first mentioned above.] One says, Xar-afa Qll-ehu AlkaEobapa, (O, Ḳ, TA,) inf. n. as above, (TA,) [God rendered, or may God render, the Kaabeh an object of honour, or glorious,] from AlX-arafu, (O, Ḳ, TA,) i. e. Almajodu. (TA.) [taXoriyfN is also used as a subst. properly so called; and as such is expl. by itself in this art.]

Also He put to it Xuraf [pl. of XurofapN, q. v.]; (O, Ḳ;) namely, his house, (Ḳ,) or a [palace, or pavilion, or other building such as is called] qaSor, &c.; inf. n. as above. (O.) [See also Xarafa AlHaAYiTa.]
Xr-f AlmarobaOa, expl. in the Ḳ as syn. with AXrfhu and XArfhu, is a mistake for tXr-fhu [q. v.]. (TA.)

Xr-f Aln-aAqapa, inf. n. as above, means He almost severed the teats of the she-camel by binding them [tightly] with the SiraAr [q. v.]: (IAạr, O, TA:) this being done for the preservation of her [stoutness of] body, and her fatness, so that burdens may be put upon her in the coming year. (TA.)
[Xr-f, app. for Xr-f AlEunuqa, is also said by Reiske, as mentioned by Freytag in his Lexicon, to signify He (a camel going along) raised the neck: but his authority for this is not stated.]

3. XArfhu, (Ṣ, O, Ḳ,) inf. n. muXaArafapN, (TA,) He vied with him, or contended with him for superiority, in Xaraf [i. e. highness, elevation, or eminence, of rank, condition, or estimation; or nobility]; (Ṣ, O, Ḳ, TA;) faXarafahu↓ and he overcame, or surpassed, him therein. (TA.)
See also 5.

Also He was, or became, near to it; he drew near to it, or approached it; namely, a thing: and he was, or became, near to attaining it, [and in like manner XArf Ealayohi, as used in the Ṣ and Ḳ in the beginning of art. blg, he was, or became, at the point of reaching it, or attaining it, namely, a place,] or of obtaining it, or getting possession of it: [and he was, or became, at the point of experiencing it, (See Bḍ in lxxviii. 14,) and doing it; followed by Oano and an aor.:] and, as some say, he looked for it, or expected it; his mind told him of it; he looked for its coming to pass. (TA.) See also 4, in two places.

hom.sense: 4. AXrf It rose; or it was, or became, high or elevated; [so as to overtop, or overlook, what was around it or adjacent to it: overtopped, surmounted, overpeered, overlooked, overhung; was, or became, protuberant, prominent, or projecting: and rose into view, came within sight or view, or became within a commanding, or near, view:] said of a place [&c.]. (Mṣb.) One says of a piece of ground, OaXorafa EalaI maA Hawolahu [It rose above, or overtopped, what was around it]. (Sh, TA.) And OaXorafa liI XarafN famaA zilotu OarokuDu Hat-aI Ealawotuhu [An eminence rose into view to me, and I ceased not to urge on my beast until I ascended, or mounted, upon it]. (TA.)

[Hence,] OaXorafotu Ealayohi I looked upon it, or viewed it, (Ṣ, O, Mṣb, Ḳ,*) from above; (Ṣ, O, Ḳ;) [I overlooked it, or looked down upon it: and I came in sight of it: got a view of it: and got knowledge of it; became acquainted with it; or knew it: all of which meanings may be intended to be conveyed by the explanation in the Mṣb, which is AiT-alaEotu Ealayohi:]
and XaArafotu↓ AlX-aIoCa signifies the same as OaXorafotu Ealayohi [app. in the first of the senses expl. in this sentence, as well as in another sense expl. in what follows]: (Ṣ, O:) and XaArafuwhumo↓ signifies the same as OaXorafuwA Ealayohimo. (TA.)

And AXrf EalaI Almawoti He (a sick man) was, or became, on the brink, or verge, or at the point, of death. (O, Ḳ.) And AXrf bihi EalaI Almawoti [He made him to be on the brink, or verge, or at the point, of death]. (T and Ḳ in art. crf.)

And OaXorafato nafosuhu EalaI XaIoCK His soul was vehemently eager for a thing. (Mgh. [See also 10.]) UiXoraAfN signifies The being eager, and the being vehemently eager: and hence the saying, in a trad., mano Oaxaca Ald-unoyaA biUiXoraAfi nafosK lamo yubaArako lahu fiyhaA [Whoso takes the enjoyments of the present world with eagerness, or vehement eagerness, of soul, he will not be blessed therein]. (TA.)
And AXrf Ealayohi He regarded him with solicitous affection or pity or compassion. (O,* Ḳ.)
[And AXrf liI He, or it, came within sight, or view, to me; or came within a commanding, or near, view of me: see an ex. voce Oajohada; and another voce rabaOa.]
And [hence,] AXrf laka AlX-aIoCu The thing became, or has become, within thy power or reach; or possible, practicable, or easy, to thee. (TA.)
See also 5, in two places.
5. tXr-f, said of a man, is from AlX-arafu, (O,) and signifies SaAra muXar-afFA [He became elevated, or exalted, in rank, condition, or estimation; or ennobled]. (Ḳ.)

tXr-f bihi He became elevated, or exalted, in rank, condition, or estimation; or ennobled; by, or by means of, him, or it: (MA:) [or he gloried, or prided himself, by reason of it, or in it; i. e.] he reckoned it, (Ṣ,) or regarded it, (O,) as a glory or an honour [to himself], (Ṣ, O,) and a favour. (O.)

tXr-f AlmarobaOa, (Ṣ, O, TA,) in the Ḳ, erroneously, Xar-afahu; (TA;) and AXrfhu↓; (Ṣ, O, Ḳ;) and XArfhu↓, (Ḳ,) inf. n. muXaArafapN; (TA;) He (a man, Ṣ, O) ascended, or mounted, upon the elevated place of observation. (Ṣ, O, Ḳ.) And AXrf↓ AlX-aIoCa and EalaI AlX-aIoCi signify the same as [tXr-fhu and] tXr-f Ealayohi, i. e. He ascended, or mounted, upon the thing. (TA.)

It is said in a trad., with reference to certain future trials, or conflicts and factions, (fitan,) mano taXar-afa lahaA tasotaXorifohu↓ i. e. Whoso finds a place of refuge [for escaping, or avoiding them, let them invite him, or cause him, to seek, or take, refuge, virtually meaning] let him seek, or take, refuge therein. (O, TA.*)
tuXur-ifa Alqawomu The people, or party, had their OaXoraAf [or eminent, or noble, men, pl. of Xariyf,] slain. (O, Ḳ.)

entry.sense: 8. AXtrf He, or it, stood up, or upright, or erect; (Ṣ, O, TA;) and (TA) so AstXrf↓ [if this be not a mistranscription, which I incline to think it may be as the former verb (of which see the part. n. below) is not mentioned in the Ḳ]. (Ḳ, TA.)

hom.sense:
10. AstXrf AlX-aIoCa, (Ṣ, O, Mṣb, Ḳ,) and lilX-aIoCi, (Mṣb in art. TmH,) He raised his eyes (Ṣ, O, Mṣb, Ḳ) towards the thing, (O, Ḳ,) or to look at the thing, (Mṣb,) or looking at the thing, (Ṣ,) and expanded his hand over his eyebrow like as does he who shades [his eyes] from the sun. (Ṣ, O, Ḳ.) A poet says,
taTaAlalotu waQsotaXorafotuhu faraOayotuhu
faqulotu lahu MOanota zayodu AlOaraAmili
[I stretched up myself, and raised my eyes towards him, expanding my hand over my eyebrow like him who is shading his eyes from the sun; and I said to him, Art thou Zeyd-el-Arámil?]. (O.)

Hence, (TA,) OumironaA Oano nasotaXorifa AlEayona waAlOucuna, (Mgh,* O, Ḳ, TA,) in a trad. (O, TA) relating to the sheep or goat to be slaughtered as a victim on the day of sacrifice, (TA,) means We have been commanded to pay much attention to the eye and the ear, and to examine them carefully, in order that there may not be any such defect as blindness of one eye or mutilation (Mgh,* O, Ḳ, TA) of an ear: (TA:) or, (Mgh, O,) as some say, (O,) [in the Ḳ “that is,”] to seek that they be of high estimation, by being perfect (Mgh,* O, Ḳ) and sound: (Mgh, O:) or, accord. to some, it is from AlX-urofapu signifying “the choice ones,” or “best,” of cattle; and the meaning is, we have been commanded to select them. (TA.)
And yasotaXorifu maEaAliIa AlOumuwri ‡ He desires, or seeks, [or raises his eye to,] the means of attaining eminence. (Mṣb in art. Xwf.)
AstXrf Uibilahumo means He (a man) smote their camels with the [evil] eye; syn. taEay-anahaA: (Ṣ, TA:) or he looked at them (tEy-nhA) to smite them with the [evil] eye. (TA.)
AstXrfhu Haq-ahu He defrauded him of his right, or due. (O, Ḳ.)
See also 5:
and 8.

entry.sense: Q. Q. 1. Xaroyafotu Alz-aroEa I cut off the XiroyaAf [q. v.] of the seed-produce; (Ṣ, O;) and so Xaronafotuhu: (O and Ḳ * in art. Xrnf:) of the dial. of El-Yemen: but Az doubts whether the word be with n; and the I and n are both held by him to be augmentative. (O.)
XarofN: see the next paragraph, near the end.

hom.sense: XarafN Highness, elevation, exaltation, or eminence, [in rank, condition, or estimation, in respect of religion or of worldly things: (see the first sentence of this art.:)] (Ṣ, O, Mṣb, Ḳ:) [generally meaning high birth:] glory, honour, dignity, or nobility; syn. majodN: or not unless [transmitted] by ancestors: (Ḳ:) [for] accord. to ISk, XarafN and majodN may not be unless [transmitted] by ancestors; but HasabN and karamN may be in a man though he have not ancestors [endowed therewith]: (O:) or, (Ḳ,) accord. to IDrd, (O,) it signifies highness of Hasab [which means grounds of pretension to respect or honour, consisting in any qualities (either of oneself or of one's ancestors) which are enumerated, or recounted, as causes of glorying]: (O, Ḳ:) and XurofapN↓ signifies the same as XarafN; (TA;) or the same as faDolN and XarafN [meaning a favour and a glory or an honour]; as in the saying, OaEud-u UitoyaAnakumN XurofapF [I reckon your coming a favour, and a glory or an honour]; (O, Ḳ;) and OaraI celika XurofapF [I regard that as a favour, and a glory or an honour]: (O:) the pl. of XarafN is OaXoraAfN, like as that of sababN is OasobaAbN. (TA.) nuhobapN caAtu XarafK means Spoil, or booty, of high value, at which men raise their eyes, and look, or which they smite with the [evil] eye: [see AisotaXorafa Uibilahumo:] but the phrase is also related with s. (TA. See sarafN.)
See also XariyfN, with which, or with the pls. of which, it is said to be syn.

Also An elevated place; an eminence: (Ṣ, Mgh, O, Ḳ:) accord. to Sh, any piece of ground that overtops what is around it, whether extended or not, only about ten cubits, or five, in length, of little or much breadth in its upper surface: (TA:) pl. OaXoraAfN: (TA voce waToCN:) and maXaArifu AlOaroDi signifies the high, or elevated, places, or parts, of the earth or ground: (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ:) sing. maXorafN↓, with fet-ḥ to the m and r. (Mṣb. [See also muXorafN.]) A poet says,
MtiI Aln-adiI-a falaA yuqar-abu majolisiI
waOaquwdu lilX-arafi Alr-afiyEi HimaAriI
[I come to the assembly, and my sitting-place is not made near to the chief person or persons, and I lead to the high elevated place my ass]: he means, I have become unsound in my intellect in consequence of old age, so that no profit is gotten from my opinion, and I am not able to mount my ass from the ground, unless from a high place. (Ṣ.)

[Hence, ‡ The brink, verge, or point, of some event of great magnitude, or of any importance: not well expl. as meaning] the being on the brink, or verge, or at the point, of some event of great importance, good or evil: (O, Ḳ:) one says in the case of good, huwa EalaI XarafK mino qaDaMCi HaAjatihi ‡ [He is at the point of accomplishing the object of his want]: and in the case of evil, huwa EalaI XarafK mina AlhalaAki ‡ [He is on the brink,, &c., of destruction]. (O, TA.)
And ‡ The hump of a camel. (O, Ḳ, TA.)
And app. sing. of OaXoraAfN in a sense expl. below: see the latter word. (TA.)

And A heat; a single run, or a run at once, to a goal, or limit: (O, Ḳ:) or, (Ḳ,) accord. to Fr, about a mile: (O, Ḳ:) or about two miles. (TA as from the Ḳ and on the authority of Fr.) One says, EadaA XarafFA Oawo Xarafayoni [He ran a heat, or two heats]: (O:) and [in like manner,] Aisotan-atN XarafFA Oawo Xarafayoni, (O, Ḳ,) occurring in a trad., said of a mare, or of horses. (O.)

entry.sense: XurofapN: see the next preceding paragraph, first quarter.
Also The choice ones, or best, of maAl [meaning cattle]. (Ṣ, O, Ḳ.)

The Xurofap of a [palace, or pavilion, or other building such as is called] qaSor (Ṣ, O, Mṣb, Ḳ) [and of a mosque] is well-known; (Ḳ;) [An acroterial ornament, forming a single member of a cresting of a wall or of the crown of a cornice, generally of a fanciful form, and pointed, or small, at the top:]
pl. XurafN, (Ṣ, Mgh, O, Mṣb, Ḳ, TA,) a pl. of mult., and XurufaAtN and XurafaAtN and XurofaAtN, which are pls. of pauc., or, as some say, XrfAt [i. e. XurufaAtN] is pl. of XurufapN↓, with two dammehs: EshShiháb says that XurofaAt is expl. as meaning the highest portions of a qaSor; but what are thus termed are only what are built on the top of a wall, distinct from one another, [side by side, like merlons of a parapet,] according to a well-known form: (TA:) the Xurofap is what is called by the [common] people Xur-aAfap↓: (Ḥam p. 824:) the Xur-aAfap of a mosque is a word used by the lawyers, and is one of their mistakes, as IB has notified: so says MF: its pl. is XaraAriyfu. (TA.)
The XurufaAt (thus with two dammehs, Ḳ) of a horse are The neck and qaTaAp [i. e. croup, or rump, or part between the hips or haunches,] thereof. (O, Ḳ.)
XurufapN: see the next preceding paragraph.

XariyfN High, elevated, exalted, or eminent, (Ṣ, O,* Mṣb, Ḳ, TA,) [in rank, condition, or estimation,] in respect of religion or of worldly things: (TA:) [generally meaning high-born, or noble:] possessing glory, honour, dignity, or nobility: or such, and having also [such] ancestry: (TA:) [using it as not implying highness, or nobility, of ancestry,] you say, huwa XariyfN Alyawoma [He is high, or noble, to-day], and XaArifN↓ Eano qaliylK as meaning one who will be Xariyf [after a little while]: (Fr, Ṣ, Ḳ:) the pl. [of pauc.] is OaXoraAfN and [of mult.] XurafaMCu (Ṣ, O, Mṣb, Ḳ) and XarafN↓, so in the Ḳ, app. denoting that this last is one of the pls. of Xryf, and it is said in the O that XarafN is syn. with XurafaMCu; but in the L it is said that it is syn. with XariyfN; and hence the saying huwa Xarafu qawomihi meaning He is the Xariyf of his people, and karamuhumo meaning the kariym of them; and thus it has been expl. as used in a trad.: (TA:) [but both these assertions are probably correct; for it seems to be, agreeably with analogy, an inf. n. used as an epithet, and therefore applicable to a single person and to a pl. number, and also to two persons, and likewise to a female as well as to a male.]

[By the modern Arabs, and the Turks and Persians, it is also applied, as a title of honour, to Any descendant of the Prophet; like say-id. And, with the article Al, particularly to the descendant of the Prophet who is The governor of Mekkeh; now always a vassal of the Turkish Sultán.]

XuraAfiI-N, applied to a [lizard of the kind called] Dab-, and to a jerboa, Large in the ears, and in the body: (TA:) and so XuraAfiy-apN applied to a she-camel; (O, Ḳ, TA;) as also XarofaMCu↓. (TA.) And OucunN XuraAfiy-apN i. q. XufaAriy-apN [q. v.], (Ḳ, TA,) or An ear that is high, long, and having hair upon it. (IDrd, O, TA.) See also OucunN XarofaMCu, voce OaXorafu.
Also A kind of white garments or cloths: (O, Ḳ:*) or a garment, or piece of cloth, that is purchased from a country of the foreigners adjacent to the land of the Arabs. (Aṣ, O, Ḳ.*)
Xur-aAfapN; pl. XaraAriyfu: see XurofapN.

XiroyaAfN (Ṣ, O, Ḳ) and XironaAfN (O and Ḳ in art. Xrnf) [but see Q. Q. 1] The leaves of seedproduce that have become so long and abundant that one fears its becoming marred; wherefore they are cut off. (Ṣ, O, Ḳ.)
XaArifN: see XariyfN.

Applied to a she-camel, † High [app. meaning much advanced] in age: (A, TA:) or advanced in age; (Ṣ, O, Ḳ;) decrepit; (IAạr, Ḳ;) as also XaArifapN: (Ḳ:) [see daluwqN, in three places:] pl. XurofN, like buzolN and EuwcN pls. of baAzilN and EaAYicN, (Ṣ, O,) or XurufN, like kutubN, (Ḳ,) or the latter is allowable in poetry, (O,) or the former is a contraction of the latter, (IAth, TA,) and XawaArifu [also pl. of XaArifapN] (O, Ḳ) and Xur-afN and XuruwfN: (Ḳ:) it is said that XaArifN is not applied to the he-camel; but it is so applied, as well as to the she-camel, accord. to the Towsheeh of El-Jelál. (TA.) Hence, as being likened to black decrepit she-camels, (Aboo-Bekr, TA,) AlX-urufu Aljuwnu, with two dammehs, [which I think a mistake, unless it mean with a ḍammeh to each word,] (Ḳ,) or AlX-arofu Aljuwnu, (O, IAth, TA,) occurring in a trad., meaning † [Trials, or conflicts and factions,] like portions of the dark night: (O,* Ḳ,* TA:) thus expl. by the Prophet: (O, TA:) but some relate it otherwise, with q, (Ḳ,) saying AlX-uroqu Aljwn, pl. of XaAriqN, (O,* TA,) meaning “ [trials, &c.,] rising (O, Ḳ, TA) from the direction of the east.” (O, TA.)

Also applied to an arrow, as meaning Old: (Ṣ, O, Ḳ:) and applied to a garment or a piece of cloth [app. in the same sense]: (A and TA voce TariydN:) or an arrow long since laid by [expl. by baEiydu AlEahodi biAlS-iyaAbapi; but I think that the right reading is bEyd AlEhd liAlS-iyaAnapi, and have assumed this to be the case in my rendering]: or of which the feathers and the sinews [wherewith they are bound] have become uncompact: or slender and long. (TA.)
dan-N XaArifN [A wine-jar] of which the wine is old. (TA.)
And XaArifN [alone] A receptacle for wine, such as a xaAbiyap and the like thereof. (O, Ḳ.)

AlX-aAruwfu A kind of cord or rope; syn. HabolN: [so in the O, and in one of my copies of the Ṣ: in my other copy of the Ṣ, and in the Ḳ, jabalN, i. e. the name of a certain mountain:] a post-classical word. (Ṣ, O.)
And XaAruwfN also signifies A broom: (Ṣ, O, Ḳ:) a Pers. word, (Ṣ,) arabicized, from jaAruwbN, (O, Ḳ,) originally jaAIo ruwbo, which means “a place-sweeper.” (O.)

OaXorafu [More, and most, high, elevated, exalted, or eminent, in rank, condition, or estimation;, &c.; generally meaning more, and most, high-born or noble; (see XariyfN;)] surpassing in Xaraf. (Ṣ, O.)

manokibN OaXorafu A high shoulder; (Ṣ, O, Ḳ;) such as has a goodly rising; which implies what is termed UihodaMC [inf. n. of OahodaOahu, and here app. meaning the “being curved in the back”]. (TA.) And OucunN XarofaMCu A long ear; (Ṣ, O, Ḳ;) standing up; rising above what is next to it: and so Acn XuraAfiy-apN↓. (TA.)
See also XuraAfiI-N [OaXorafu also signifies Having a prominent, or an apparent, ear: opposed to Oasak-u, q. v.]

[Hence,] AlOaXorafu is an appellation of The bat; (O, Ḳ, TA;) because its ears are prominent and apparent: it is bare of downy and other feathers, and is viviparous, not oviparous: so in the saying of Bishr Ibn-El-Moatemir,
waTaAYirN OaXorafu cuw jurodapK
waTaAYirN layosa lahu wakoru
[And a flying thing that has prominent and apparent ears and a denuded body, and a flying thing that has no nest]: (O, TA:) in the Ḳ is added, and another bird, that has no nest,, &c.: but this is taken from an explanation of the latter hemistich of the verse cited above; which explanation is as follows: (TA:) the bird that has no nest is one of which the Bahránees [so in the TA, but accord. to the O “the sailors,”] tell that it does not alight save while it makes, of the dust, or earth, a place in which it lays its eggs, and which it covers over; then it flies into the air, and its eggs break open of themselves at the expiration of the term thereof; and when its young ones are able to fly, they do after the habit of their parents. (O, L, TA: and the same is said, less fully, in the Ḳ.)

madiynapN XarofaMCu A city having Xuraf, (Mgh, O, Ḳ,*) pl. of XurofapN [q. v.]: (O:) the pl. of OaXorafu and of XarofaMCu, accord. to rule, is XurofN. (Mgh. [In the copies of the Ḳ, AlX-urufu is erroneously said to be pl. of AlX-arofaMCu.]) It is said in a trad. of Ibn-ʼAbbás, OumironaA Oano naboniIa AlmadaAYina XurofFA waAlmasaAjida jum-FA i. e. We have been commanded to build cities with Xuraf and mosques without Xuraf. (Mgh, O.*)
OaXoraAfN The ears and nose of a man: (O, Ḳ, TA:) its sing. in this sense is not mentioned: it is app. XarafN↓; like sababN, sing. of OasobaAbN. (TA.)
taXoriyfN inf. n. of 2 [q. v.]. (Ṣ, &c.)
[And also a post-classical term applied to An honorary present, such as a garment, &c.: and a letter, i. e. an epistle, considered as conferring honour: pl. taXoriyfaAtN.]
maXorafN: see XarafN, in the middle of the paragraph: and see also what here next follows.
muXorafN, (O, Ḳ,) like mukoramN, (Ḳ,) or maXorafN↓ [q. v. voce XarafN], (so in my two copies of the Ṣ,) A place from which one overlooks, i. e. looks upon, or views, [a thing] from above. (Ṣ, O, Ḳ.)

Hence the saying in a trad., maA jaMCaka mino hecaA AlmaAli waOanota gayoru muXorafK walaA saAYilK faxucohu (O, TA) i. e. [What comes to thee of this property] thou not coveting nor looking for it [nor asking it, take it]. (O.)
muXorifN [part. n. of 4;] High; (Ṣ, Mgh, Mṣb;) [or overtopping;, &c.;] applied to a mountain, (Ṣ,) or a place. (Mgh, Mṣb.)

suyuwfN maXorafiy-apN Certain swords, (Ṣ, O, Ḳ,) so called in relation to maXaArifu, (Ṣ,) or in relation to maXaArifu AlX-aAmi, (O, Mṣb, Ḳ,) i. e. certain towns, or villages, of the land of the Arabs, near to the riyf [q. v.]: (Ṣ, O, Mṣb, Ḳ:) so says AO: (Ṣ, O:) or, as some say, this is a mistake, and they are so called in relation to a place of El-Yemen: (Mṣb:) [or, accord. to some, in relation to AlmaXaArifu, certain towns, or villages, near Howrán: (see De Sacy's Chrest. Ar., sec. ed., iii. 53:)] and it is said that maXoraf was the name of a blacksmith who made swords: (TA:) one says sayofN maXorafiI-N, (Ṣ, O, Mṣb,) not maXaArifiI-N, because a rel. n. is not formed from a pl. of the measure of maXaArifu. (Ṣ, O.)

hom.sense: muXar-afN [Elevated, or exalted, in rank, condition, or estimation; or ennobled]; (Ḳ, TA;) an epithet applied to a man; from AlX-arafu. (TA.)
Also A garment, or piece of cloth, dyed with the red clay or earth [&c.] called Xaraf. (IAạr, TA.)

entry.sense: maXoruwfN (Ṣ, TA) and maXoruwfN Ealayohi (Z, TA) Overcome, or surpassed, in Xaraf [i. e. highness, elevation, or eminence, of rank, condition, or estimation; or nobility]. (Ṣ, Z, TA.)
muXotarifN A horse high in make. (Ṣ, O, Ḳ.)

hom.sense: 1. Xaraqati AlX-amosu, (Ṣ, M, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ,) aor. _u {yaXoruqu}, (Ṣ, M, Mṣb,) inf. n. XuruwqN (Ṣ, M, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ) and XaroqN, (Ṣ, Mṣb,) The sun rose; (Ṣ, M, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ;) as also OaXoraqat↓: (Ḳ:) the sun rose from the east; and in like manner one says of the moon, and of the stars: (M:) or the sun rose so that its light began to fall upon the earth and trees: (T and TA in art. cr:) and AXrqt↓ signifies, as distinguished from Xaraqat, (Ṣ, M, Mgh, Mṣb,) or signifies also, (Ḳ, TA,) for both verbs are correctly expl. in the Ḳ as above, (TA,) it shone, or gave its light, (Ṣ, M, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ, TA,) and spread (M, TA) upon the earth, or ground: (TA:) or, as some say, Xaraqat, and AXrqt↓ are syn., (M, Mṣb,) as meaning it (the sun) shone: (M:) and XaroqN [as inf. n. of the former verb] signifies the shining of the sun. (Ḳ.)
And Xaraqa Aln-axolu, and AXrq↓, The palm-trees showed redness in their fruit: (M, Ḳ:*) or showed the colours of their dates. (AḤn, M.) [See also Xariqa in what follows.]
Xaraqa AlX-aApa, (Ṣ, O, Mṣb, Ḳ,) aor. _u {yaXoruqu}, (Ṣ, O, Mṣb,) inf. n. XaroqN, He slit the ear of the sheep, or goat, (Ṣ, O, Mṣb, Ḳ,) in the manner expl. voce XaroqaMCu. (Mṣb.)

And Xaraqa Alv-amarapa, (Az, Ḳ,) inf. n. XaroqN, (IAmb, Az, TA,) He plucked the fruit: (Az, Ḳ, TA:) or cut it. (IAmb, Az, TA.) One says in crying baAqil-aMC [or beans], Xaroqu AlgadaApi TariI-N The cutting of the morning, fresh! meaning what has been cut, and picked, in the morning. (IAmb, Az, TA.)

Xariqa, [aor. _a {yaXoraqu},] inf. n. XaraqN, It (a place) was, or became, bright by reason of the sun's shining upon it; as also AXrq↓; (M, TA;) [whence,] waOaXoraqati↓ QloOaroDu binuwri rab-ihaA occurs in the Ḳur [xxxix. 69 as meaning And the earth shall shine with the light of its Lord]: (M:) [in other instances,] OaXoraqati AlOaroDu means The earth was, or became, bright with the sunshine. (TA.)
[Hence, perhaps, or, though not immediately, from what here next follows, some other applications of this verb, to denote redness.]

Xariqa biriyqihi, (Ṣ, M, Mṣb, Ḳ,) and biAlmaMCi, and the like, (M,) aor. _a {yaXoraqu}, (Mṣb,) inf. n. XaraqN, (M, Mṣb,) He (a man, M, Mṣb) was, or became, choked with his spittle, (Ṣ, M, Mṣb, Ḳ,) and with water,, &c. (M.) [And jariDa and gaS-a and XajiIa are sometimes used in the same sense in relation to spittle, &c.]
[Hence,] Xariqa AljuroHu biAld-ami † The wound became [choked or] filled with blood. (Mṣb.)
And Xariqa AlmawoDiEu biOaholihi ‡ The place became [choked or] filled and straitened by its occupants. (TA.)
And Xariqa Aljasadu biAlT-iybi ‡ [The body became choked in its pores with perfume]. (TA.)
[And Xariqa Alv-awobu biAljaAdiI-i † The garment, or piece of cloth, became glutted, or saturated, with the dye of saffron: see the part. n. XariqN.]
And Xariqa lawonuhu, inf. n. XaraqN, † His colour, or complexion, became red, by reason of shame, or shame and confusion. (TA.)
And [hence, app.,] Xariqa AlX-aIoCu, inf. n. as above, † The thing became intensely red, with blood, or with a beautiful red colour. (M, TA.)
And also † The thing became mixed, commingled, or blended. (M, TA.)

Xariqati AlX-amosu, inf. n. as above, means ‡ The sun had a duskiness blended with it, and it [app. the duskiness] then became little: (TA:) or it was near to setting: (M, Ḳ:) or became feeble in its light; (O, Ḳ;) app. from XariqN applied to flesh-meat as meaning “red, having no grease, or gravy,” and applied to a garment, or piece of cloth, as meaning “red, that has become glutted, or saturated, (Xariqa,) with dye;” because its colour, in the last part of the day, when it is setting, becomes red. (O.)

The phrase yuWax-iruwna AlS-alaApa UilaI Xaraqi AlmawotaI, (Ṣ, M, O, Ḳ, [in the CK, erroneously, Xaroqi,]) occurring in a trad., (Ṣ, M, O,) in a saying of the Prophet, (O, Ḳ,) is expl. as meaning Who postpone, or defer, the prayer until there remains not, (Ṣ, M, O, Ḳ,) of the sun, (Ṣ,) or of the day, (M, O, Ḳ,) save as much as remains (Ṣ, M, O, Ḳ) of the life, (Ṣ,) or of the breath, (M, O, Ḳ, [but in the CK, nafosi is put in the place of nafasi,]) of the dying who is choked with his spittle: (Ṣ, M, O, Ḳ:) or the meaning is, until the sun is [but just] above the walls, and [diffusing its feeble light] among the graves (M, O, Ḳ *) as though it were a great expanse of water. (M, O.) AZ says, yukorahu AlS-alaApu biXaraqi AlmawotaI means Prayer is disapproved when the sun becomes yellow: and faEalotu celika biXaraqi AlmawotaI I did that when the sun was becoming yellow. (TA.)
Xariqati AlX-aApu, (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ,) aor. _a {yaXoraqu}, (Mṣb, Ḳ,) inf. n. XaraqN, (Ṣ, Mṣb,) The sheep, or goat, had its ear slit (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ) in the manner expl. voce XaroqaMCu. (Mṣb, Ḳ.)

2. Xr-q, (TA,) inf. n. taXoriyqN, (Ṣ, O, Ḳ,) He took to the direction of the east, or place of sunrise: (Ṣ, O, Ḳ, TA:) he went to the east: he came to the east: (M, TA:) and he directed himself to the east. (TA.)
And He prayed at sunrise: and hence, app., He performed the prayer of the festival of the sacrifice: (TA:) or this meaning is from Xaraqati AlX-amosu. (Mgh: it is also mentioned in the M.)

Xr-qt AlOaroDu, inf. n. as above, The land became affected with drought, and dryness of the earth, being [parched by the sun and] not reached by water: whence the term XaraAqiI-↓ [q. v.] in the dial. of Egypt. (TA.)
taXoriyqN also signifies The being beautiful, and [sunny or] shining in face. (Sh, O, Ḳ.)

Xr-q All-aHoma, (M, Mgh, Mṣb,) inf. n. as above, (Ṣ, M, Mgh, O, Mṣb, Ḳ,) He cut the flesh-meat into strips, and dried it in the sun, or spread it in the sun to dry: (Ṣ, M, Mgh, O, Mṣb, Ḳ:) or [simply] he cut it into pieces, and into strips. (Mṣb.) [In like manner also] taXoriyqu AlX-aEiyri signifies The throwing barley in a sunny place in order that it may dry. (Mgh.) And one says of the [wild] bull, yuXar-iqu matonahu, meaning He exposes his back to the sun in order that what is upon it of the dew of night may dry: in this sense the phrase is used by Aboo-Dhu-eyb. (M.)

Oay-aAmu Alt-aXoriyqi is an appellation of The three days next after the day of sacrifice: (Ṣ, M, O, Mṣb:) [i. e. the eleventh and twelfth and thirteenth days of Dhu-l-Hijjeh:] these days were so called because the flesh of the victims was therein cut into strips, and dried in the sun, or spread in the sun to dry: (Ṣ, M, Mgh, O, Mṣb, Ḳ:*) or because the victims were not sacrificed until the sun rose: (IAạr, Ṣ, O, Ḳ:) or from the prayer of the day of sacrifice, which they follow: (Mgh:) or because they used to say, [on that day,] (Ṣ, M, O,) in the Time of Ignorance, (M,) OaXoriqo↓ vabiyro kayomaA nugiyro, (Ṣ, M, O,) which means Enter thou upon the time of sunrise, Thebeer, (addressing one of the mountains of Mekkeh, M,* Mgh,) that we may push, or press, on, or forward, (M, Mgh, Mṣb,) to return from Minè: (M: [see also 4 in art. gwr:]) Aboo-Ḥaneefeh used to hold that Alt-aXoriyq means Alt-akobiyr [i. e. the saying Aall-ehu Oakobaro]; but none beside him has held this opinion. (TA.) It is said in a trad. that the days thus called are days of eating and drinking, and of celebrating the praises of God. (O.)

Xr-q Alv-awoba † He made [or dyed] the garment, or piece of cloth, yellow: (Ibn-ʼAbbád, O:) [or he dyed it red: (see the pass. part. n., below:)] or taXoriyqN signifies the dyeing with saffron, (M, L,) so that the thing dyed is saturated, (L,) or not so that the thing is saturated: (so in a copy of the M:) it is not with safflower. (M, L. [See also 4, last signification.])
Xr-q AlaHowaD is sometimes said for Sar-ajahu, meaning He plastered the watering-trough, or tank, with XaAruwq [q. v.], or SaAruwj. (M in art. Srj.)
4. AXrq: see 1, in six places. One says also, AXrq wajohuhu, (Ṣ,) and lawonuhu, (M,) His face, (Ṣ,) and his colour, or complexion, (M,) shone, (Ṣ, M,) and was bright, with beauty. (Ṣ.)

Some allow its being made trans.; [meaning It caused, or made, to shine;] as in the saying,
valaAvapN tuXoraqu Ald-unoyaA bibahojatihaA
Xamosu AlD-uHaI waOabuw UisoHaAqa wAlqamaru
[There are three things, with the beauty of which the world is made to shine; the sun of the bright early morning, and Aboo-Is-ḥáḳ, and the moon]: but there is no proof in this, because [the right reading may be tuXoriqu, and so] AldnyA may be an agent; therefore the making the verb trans. [in this sense] is said to be post-classical, though it is mentioned by the author of the Ksh. (MF, TA.)
It signifies also He entered upon the time of sunrise: (Ṣ, M, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ:) similarly to Oafojara, and OaSobaHa, and OaZohara. (TA.) See 2.

AXrq Eaduw-ahu He caused his enemy to become choked [with his spittle, or with water, or the like: see 1]. (O, Ḳ.) And OaXoraqotu fulaAnFA biriyqihi ‡ [I choked the utterance, or impeded the action, of such a one;] I did not allow such a one to say, or to do, a thing. (Z, TA.)

AXrq Alv-awoba biAlS-ibogi, (Moḥeeṭ, A, O,) or fiI AlS-ibogi, (Ḳ,) ‡ He exceeded the usual degree in dyeing the garment, or piece of cloth; [saturated it with dye;] or dyed it thoroughly. (Ḳ, TA. [See also 2, last signification but one.])

entry.sense: 5. tXr-q He sat in a sunny place (Ṣ, O, Ḳ) [at any season, (see maXoruqapN,) or particularly] in winter. (O, Ḳ.)
And tXr-qwA They looked through the miXoriyq of the door, i. e. the chink thereof into which the light of the rising sun falls. (O.)
7. AnXrqt Alqawosu The bow split. (Ibn-ʼAbbád, O, Ḳ.)
12. AiXoraworaqato Eayonuhu: see 1, latter half.
AiXoraworaqa biAld-amoEi ‡ He became drowned in tears. (Ibn-ʼAbbád, O, Ḳ, TA.)

hom.sense: XaroqN [an inf. n.: see 1, first sentence.]

[Also] The sun; (Ṣ, O, Ḳ;) and so XaraqN↓: (Ḳ, and thus in one of my copies of the Ṣ in the place of the former:) [or] XaroqapN↓ has this signification: (M, Mṣb:) and XaroqN signifies the rising sun; (M, TA;) as some say; (M;) thus accord. to AA and IAạr; (TA;) and so XaraqN↓, (M, Mṣb,) and XaroqapN↓, and XariqapN↓, (M, Ḳ,) and XaraqapN↓, (TA,) and XaAriqN↓, (Ṣ,* M, Ḳ,) and XariyqN↓: (M, Ḳ:) one says, TalaEati AlX-aroqu The sun rose; (Ṣ, M, O; in one of my copies of the Ṣ AlX-araqu↓;) but not garabati AlX-aroqu: (M:) and Mtiyka kul-a XaAriqK↓ I will come to thee every day that the sun rises: or, as some say, XaAriqN signifies the upper limb (qaron) of the sun: (M:) and one says, laA Mtiyka maA car-a XaAriqN [I will not come to thee as long as a sun, or the upper limb of a sun, rises, or begins to rise]. (Ṣ, M.)
See also maXoriqN, in three places.
Also A place where the sun shines (Hayovu tuXoriqu AlX-amosu). (Ḳ.) See maXoruqapN.
The warmth of the sun. (TA.)

The light that enters from the chink of a door; (IAạr, Th, Ḳ;) as also XiroqN↓. (Ḳ.) In a trad. of I’Ab, (TA,) it is said of a gate in Heaven, called AlmiXoriyqu↓ [q. v.], qado rud-a Hat-aI maA baqiIa Uil-aA Xaroquhu (O, Ḳ, TA) i. e. It had been closed so that there remained not save its light entering from the chink thereof: so says I’Ab. (O, TA.)
And A chink, or fissure. (Ḳ, TA.) One says, maA daxala Xaroqa famiI XaIoCN Nothing entered the chink of my mouth. (Z, TA.)

Also A certain bird, (Sh, M, Ḳ,) one of the birds of prey, (M,) between the kite and the hawk, or falcon, (Sh, Ḳ,) or between the kite and the [species of falcon called] XaAhiyn [q. v.]: (O:) pl. XuruwqN. (M.)

entry.sense: XiroqN: see the next preceding paragraph.
XaraqN [inf. n. of Xariqa, q. v.]
[And also a subst.]: see XaroqN, in three places.
Also A thing [such as spittle and the like (see Xariqa)] obstructing, or choking, the throat, or fauces. (Ṣ, and Ḥar p. 477.)
XariqN A place bright by reason of the sun's shining upon it; as also muXoriqN↓. (M, TA.)
A man choked with his spittle, or with water, or the like. (M, TA.)
† A plant, or herbage, having plentiful irrigation; or flourishing and fresh, or juicy, by reason of plentiful irrigation; syn. ray-aAnu. (TA.)

† A garment, or piece of cloth, red; that is glutted, or saturated, [so I render Aal-aciI Xariqa,] with dye: (O:) and XariqN biAljaAdiI-i applied to a garment, or piece of cloth, [app. signifies † glutted, or saturated, with the dye of saffron: see also muXar-aqN, and see 4.] (TA.) One says also SariyEN XariqN bidamihi † [Prostrated,] dyed with his blood. (M, TA.)
‡ Flesh-meat (Ṣ, M, O, TA) that is red, (M, O, TA,) having no grease, or gravy. (Ṣ, M, O, TA.)
† A thing intensely red, with blood, or with a beautiful red colour. (M.)
And † A thing mixed, commingled, or blended. (M.)
XaroqapN: see XaroqN, in two places:
and see maXoruqapN, in two places.
XuroqapN † Anxiety, grief, or anguish; syn. in Pers. Oanoduwho. (KL.)

hom.sense: XaraqapN: see XaroqN:
and see maXoruqapN.
Also A brand with which a sheep, or goat, such as is termed XaroqaMC, is marked. (O, Ḳ.)

entry.sense: XariqapN: see XaroqN.

XaApN XaroqaMCu A sheep, or goat, having its ear slit (Ṣ, Mgh, O, Ḳ) lengthwise, (Ḳ,) without its being separated: (TA:) or having the ear slit in two, (Aṣ, Mṣb, TA,) as though it were a zanamap [q. v.]: (Aṣ, TA:) or XaroqaMCu applied to an ear signifies cut at its extremities, without having anything thereof separated: and applied to a she-goat (maEozap), having its ear slit lengthwise, without its being separated: and, as some say, applied to a XAp, having the inner part of its ear slit on one side with a separating slitting, the middle of its ear being left sound: or, accord. to Aboo-ʼAlee in the “Tedhkireh,” XaroqaMCu signifies having its ears slit with two slits passing through, so as to become three distinct pieces. (M.)

hom.sense: XaroqiI-N [Of, or relating to, the east, or place of sunrise; eastern, or oriental].

laA Xaroqiy-api walaA garobiy-apK, (Ḳ, TA,) in the Ḳur [xxiv. 35], (TA,) means Not such that the sun shines upon it at its rising only (Fr, Ḳ, TA) nor at its setting only, (Fr, TA,) but such that the sun lights upon it morning and evening: (Fr, Ḳ, TA:) or, accord. to El-Ḥasan, it means not of the trees of the people of the present world, but of the trees of the people of Paradise: Az, however, says that the former explanation is more fit and more commonly receive. (TA.) And makaAnN XaroqiI-N signifies A place, of the earth, or ground, in, or upon, which the sun rises, or shines. (TA.) See also XaAriqN [and XariqN and maXoruqapN].
Also A certain red dye. (TA.)

entry.sense: XariyqN: see XaroqN.
Also A boy, or young man, goodly, or beautiful, (Ḳ, TA,) in face: (TA:) pl. XuruqN, (Ḳ, TA, [in the CK XaroqN, but correctly]) with two dammehs. (TA.)
And A woman small in the vulva: (Ibn-ʼAbbád, O, Ḳ:) or having her vagina and rectum united by the rending of the separation between them; syn. mufoDaApN. (M, Ḳ.)
And AlX-ariyqu is the name of A certain idol. (M, TA.)
[Xurayoqap The first part of the rising sun. (Freytag, from the Deewán of the Hudhalees.) See also XaAriqN, voce XaroqN.]
XaraAqiI-u [The lands that are not reached by the water, or inundation, and that are consequently parched by the sun]: a word of the dial. of Egypt. (TA.) See 2.

hom.sense: XaAriqN: see XaroqN, in two places.

Also The side that is next the east; (O;) the eastern side; (Ḳ;) of a hill, and of a mountain: you say, hecaA XaAriqu Aljabali and Xaroqiy-uhu↓ [This is the eastern side of the mountain], and hcA gaAribu Aljabali and garobiy-uhu [in the opposite sense]: (TA:) pl. XuroqN. (O, Ḳ.) Hence, in a trad., as some relate it, AlX-uroqu Aljuwnu [meaning † Trials, or conflicts and factions, like portions of the dark night, rising from the direction of the east]: but it is otherwise related, with f [in the place of the q: see XaArifN]. (TA.)
And AlX-aAriqu is the name of A certain idol, of the Time of Ignorance; (IDrd, M, Ḳ;) whence Eabodu AlX-aAriqi, a proper name [of a man]. (IDrd, M.)
Also [if not a mistranscription for XaAruwqN, q. v., app. Clay, or some other substance or mixture, with which a place is plastered,] maA yuTay-anu bihi makaAnN. (Ibn-ʼAbbád, O.)

entry.sense: XaAruwqN signifies [The kind of plaster called] kilosN, [q. v.,] (Kr, M,) i. q. SaAruwjN. (Ḳ. [See this last word: and see also the last sentence of the next preceding paragraph above.])
maXoraqN: see what next follows.

maXoriqN (Ṣ, M, O, Mṣb, Ḳ,) which by rule should be maXoraqN↓, (M, Mṣb,) but this latter is rarely used, (Mṣb,) The place, (M,) or quarter, or direction, (Mṣb,) of sunrise; (M, Mṣb;) [the east, or orient;] and XaroqN↓ signifies the same; (Ṣ, M, O, Mṣb, Ḳ;) as also miXoriyqN↓: (Seer, M:) the pl. of the first is maXaAriqu; and the pl. of XaroqN↓ is OaXoraAqN. (M.) The dual, AlmaXoriqaAni, means The place of sunrise of summer and that of winter [E. 26 degrees N. and E. 26 degrees Ṣ. in Central Arabia]. (Ṣ, O, TA.) And also The place of sunrise and the place of sunset; [or the east and the west;] (M, O;) the former being thus made predominant because it denotes existence, whereas the latter denotes non-existence: (M:) thus in the saying, (M, O,) in the Ḳur [xliii. 37], (O,) yaA layota bayoniI wabayonaka buEoda QlomaXoriqayoni [O, would that between me and thee were the distance of the east and the west]. (M, O.) And [in like manner] one says maA bayona AlX-aroqayoni↓, meaning What is between the place of sunrise and the place of sunset. (M.)
See also maXoruqapN.

The saying, cited by IAạr,
qulotu lisaEodK wahowa biAlOazoAriqi
Ealayoka biAlmaHoDi wabiAlmaXaAriqi
he explains as meaning [I said to Saạd, he being at El-Azárik (a certain water in the baAdiyap, TA in art. zrq)], Keep thou [to pure milk, and] to the sun [or the places of sunshine] in winter: but [ISd says,] in my opinion, AlmaXaAriq is here pl. of muXar-aqN↓ applied to flesh-meat that is “ [cut into strips and] spread in the sun [to dry];” and this is confirmed by his saying bAlmHD, each of them being food. (M.)
muXoriqN: see XariqN.
Also Entering upon the time of sunrise: the pl. occurs in this sense in the Ḳur xv. 73 and xxvi. 60. (TA.)

maXoruqapN and maXoraqapN (Ṣ, M, O, Ḳ) and maXoriqapN, (M, O, Ḳ,) the last mentioned by Ks, (O,) A place of sitting in the sun; (Ṣ, O, Ḳ;) accord. to some, peculiarly, (TA,) in the winter; (O, Ḳ, TA;) and XaroqapN↓ and miXoraAqN↓ (Ṣ, O, Ḳ) and miXoriyqN↓ (O, Ḳ) signify the same: (Ṣ, O, Ḳ:) or a place upon which the sun shines; accord. to some, peculiarly, in the winter, (M,) as also XaroqapN↓ and XaraqapN↓ (M, TA) and XaroqN↓ (M) and mXrq [app. maXoriqN↓, of the pl. of which, or of one of the first three words in this paragraph, see an ex. in a verse cited voce maXoriqN if the explanation of that verse by IAạr be correct]. (TA.)
maXoriqiI-N (Mṣb, TA) and maXoraqiI-N both [applied to a man] signify Of the east; or eastern: (Mṣb:) pl. maXaAriqapN. (TA.)

hom.sense: muXar-aqN A place of prayer; syn. muSal-FI; (Aṣ, Ṣ, M, Mgh, Ḳ;) i. e., in an absolute sense: (TA:) or the place of prayer of the festival (AlEiyd): (TA:) or the place of prayer of the two festivals: and AlmuXar-aqu is said to mean the place of prayer of the festival at Mekkeh: (M, TA:) and the mosque of El-Kheyf. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
And The festival (AlEiyd) [itself]: because the prayer thereon is after the Xaroqap, i. e. the [rising] sun. (M.)
Also Flesh-meat [cut into strips and] spread in the sun [to dry: see its verb, 2]. (M.) See also maXoriqN, last sentence.
And A garment, or piece of cloth, [dyed yellow: or with saffron: see, again, its verb: or] dyed with a red colour. (O, Ḳ.)
And a fortress [or a watering-trough or tank (see 2, last sentence,)] plastered with XaAruwq. (O, Ḳ.)

entry.sense: muXar-iqN Taking to the direction of the east, or place of sunrise: one says, Xat-aAna bayona muXar-iqK wamugar-ibK [Different, or widely different, are one going towards the east and one going towards the west]. (Ṣ.)

hom.sense: miXoraAqN: see maXoruqapN.
Also A man accustomed to make his enemy to be choked with his spittle. (Z, TA.)

entry.sense: miXoriyqN: see maXoriqN:
and maXoruqapN.
Also, (M, O, Ḳ,) of a door, (M, Ḳ,) A chink into which the light of the rising sun falls. (M,* O, Ḳ.*)
And AlmiXoriyqu is the name of A gate for repentance, in Heaven. (I’Ab, O, Ḳ.) See XaroqN.
XiriqoraAqN and its vars.: see art. Xqrq.

hom.sense: 1. Xarikahu fiyhi, aor. _a {yaXoraku}, inf. n. XirokapN (Ṣ, Mgh,* Mṣb, Ḳ) and XarikapN, the former a contraction of the latter, but the more usual, (Mṣb,) and XirokN (Mgh, Mṣb) and XarikN, the former of these two a contraction of the latter, but the more usual, (Mṣb,) or XirokN [q. v. infrà] is a simple subst., (Ṣ, Ḳ,) [He shared, participated, or partook, with him in it;] he was, or became, a Xariyk [or copartner, &c.] to him in it; (Mṣb;) namely, a sale or purchase, and an inheritance, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) or an affair; (Mṣb;) and XArkhu↓ fyh [signifies the same]. (Mgh, Mṣb,* Ḳ.* [It is said in the TA, after the mention of Xarikahu with its inf. n. XirokapN, that it is more chaste than AXrkhu↓; by which it is implied that this latter is sometimes used as syn. with the former; for which I do not find any express authority.]) And He entered with him into it; [or engaged with him in it;] namely, an affair. (TA.)
Xarikati Aln-aEolu, aor. _a {yaXoraku}, The sandal had its XiraAk broken; (Ibn-Buzurj, Ḳ;) inf. n. XarakN. (TḲ.)
2: see 4.
[The inf. n.] taXoriykN also signifies The selling a part [or share] of what one has purchased for that for which it was purchased. (Mgh, Ḳ.)
Xr-k Aln-aEola, (Ṣ,* Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ,) inf. n. taXoriykN, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) He put a XiraAk to the sandal; (Ṣ, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ;) as also OaXorakahaA↓, (Ṣ, TA,) inf. n. UiXoraAkN. (TA.)

entry.sense:
3. XaArakotu fulaAnFA, (Ṣ, TA,) inf. n. muXaArakapN, (TḲ,) [I shared, participated, or partook, with such a one;] I was, or became, the Xariyk [or copartner, &c.] of such a one. (Ṣ, TA.) El-Jaadee says,
waXaArakonaA qurayoXFA fiI tuqaAhaA
wafiI OaHosaAbihaA Xiroka↓ AlEinaAni
[And we shared with Kureysh in their piety and in their several grounds of pretension to respect, with a sharing exclusive of other properties]. (Ṣ.) See also 1. [And see 8.]

hom.sense: 4. OaXorakotuhu fiI AlOamori I made him a Xariyk [or copartner, &c.] to me in the affair: and Xar-akotu↓ bayonahumo fiI AlmaAli [I made them copartners in the property; and Xar-akahumo, occurring in this art. in the TA, on the authority of Esh-Sháfiʼee, means, in like manner, he made them copartners; and OaXoraka bayonahumo is used in this sense in the present art. in the Ḳ]. (Mṣb.) waOaXorikohu fiI OamoriI, in the Ḳur [xx. 33], means And make Thou him my Xariyk [or copartner, or associate, or colleague,] in my affair. (Ṣ.) And one says also, AXrkhu maEahu fiI AlOamori He made him to enter [or engage] with him in the affair: and AXrk fulaAnFA fiI AlbayoEi He made such a one to enter [or share] with him in the sale or purchase. (TA.)

[Hence,] AXrk biQll-ehi He attributed to God a Xariyk [or copartner, &c.] (Mgh, TA) in his dominion: (TA:) [or he attributed to God XurakaMC i. e. copartners, &c., such as the angels and the devils: (see Ḳur vi. 100, &c., and any of the expositions thereof:) i. e. he believed in a duality, or a plurality, of gods:] and [in a wider sense,] he disbelieved [or misbelieved] in God: syn. kafara: (Ṣ,* Mṣb, Ḳ, TA:) used in this latter sense because Alkuforu is not free from some kind of Xirok. (Kull p. 49.)
See also 1:
and 2.

entry.sense: 6: see the next paragraph {8}, in three places.

8. AXtrkwA and tXArkwA↓, (Mgh, Mṣb,) and AXtrkA and tXArkA↓, (Ḳ,) and AXtrknA and tXArknA↓, (Ṣ,) [They, and they two, and we, shared, participated, or partook, one with another, and each with the other; or were, or became, copartners,, &c.;] fiI kacaA [in such a thing]. (Ṣ.)

[Hence,] AlAiXotiraAku in lexicology signifies The being homonymous; lit. the being shared, or participated, in by several meanings: [used as a subst., homonymy:] (Mz, 25th nwE; and Intr. to the TA:) one says of a noun [or word] that is termed muXotarakN [q. v.], taXotariku fiyhi maEaAnK kaviyrapN [Many meanings share, or participate, in it]. (TA.)
And AXtrk AlOamoru † The affair, or case, was, or became, confused, and dubious. (TA.)
XarokN: see what next follows.

XirokN is an inf. n. of Xarikahu, as mentioned in the first sentence of this art.: (Mgh, Mṣb:) or a subst. therefrom: (Ṣ:)
and is syn. with XirokapN↓, [signifying A sharing, participating or participation, partaking, or copartnership, and mentioned before as an inf. n.,] (Ḳ,) as also are XarikN↓ and XarikapN↓, [likewise mentioned before as inf. ns.,] and XarokN↓ and XarokapN↓, (MF, TA,) and so is XurokapN↓, with damm, (Ḳ,) this last said by MF to be unknown, but it is common in Syria, almost to the exclusion of the other dial. vars. mentioned above. (TA.) An ex. of the first occurs in a trad, of Mo'ádh, OajaAza bayona Oaholi Alyamani AlX-iroka, meaning [He allowed, among the people of El-Yemen,] the sharing, one with another, (AlAiXotiraAk,) in land [and app. its produce], by its owner giving it to another for the half [app. of its produce], or the third, or the like thereof: and a similar ex. of the same word occurs in another trad. (TA.) See also an ex. in a verse cited above, conj. 3. And one says, ragibonaA fiI Xirokikumo, meaning We are desirous of sharing with you in affinity, or relationship by marriage. (Ḳ,* TA.)

And A share: (Mgh, O, Mṣb, TA:) as in the saying, biyEa XirokN mino daArihi [A share of his house was sold]: (Mgh:) and as in the saying, OaEotaqa XirokFA lahu fiI EabodK [He emancipated a share belonging to him in a slave]: (Mṣb:) pl. OaXoraAkN. (O, Mṣb, TA.) [See a verse of Lebeed cited voce zaEaAmapN.]

It is also a subst. from OaXoraka biQll-ehi; (Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ, TA;) thus in the Ḳur xxxi. 12; (Mgh, TA;) meaning The attribution of a Xariyk [or copartner, &c., or of XurakaMC i. e. copartners, &c., (see 4,)] to God: (Mgh:) [so that it may be rendered belief in a plurality of gods:] and [in a wider sense,] unbelief [or misbelief]; syn. kuforN. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ, TA.) And it is also expl. as meaning Hypocrisy: (Mgh, TA:) so in the saying of the Prophet, Uin-a Oaxowafa maA OaxaAfu EalaI Oum-atiI AlX-iroku [Verily the most fearful of what I fear for my people is hypocrisy]: (Mgh:) and so in the trad., AlX-iroku OaxofaI fiI Oum-atiI mino dabiybi Aln-amoli [Hypocrisy is more latent in my people than the creeping of ants]. (IAth, TA.)
See also XariykN, in two places.

XarakN The HibaAlap [properly a sing., meaning snare, but here app. used as a gen. n., meaning snares, as will be seen from what follows,] of the SaAYid [i. e. sportsman, or catcher of game, or wild animals, or birds]; one of which is called XarakapN↓: (Ṣ, O:) the meaning of the Xarak of the SaAYid is well known; and the pl. is OaXoraAkN; like sababN and OasobaAbN: or, as some say, XarakN is the pl. of XarakapN↓, [or rather is a coll. gen. n. of which XarakapN↓ is the n. un.,] like qaSabN and qaSabapN: (Mṣb:) [i. e.,] XarakN signifies the HabaAYil [or snares, or by this may perhaps be meant the cords composing a snare, for HabaAYilu is an anomalous pl. of HabolN,] for catching wild animals or the like; and what is, or are, set up for [catching] birds: (Ḳ, TA:) one whereof is said to be called XarakapN↓ [a term used in the Ḳ, in art. Xbk, as the explanation of XabakapN, which means a net]: (TA:) and the pl. of XarakN is XurukN, with two dammehs, which is extr. [with respect to analogy, like fulukN pl. of falakN]. (Ḳ.) Hence the trad., OaEuwcu bika mino Xar-i AlX-ayoTaAni waXarakihi, meaning HabaAYilihi wamaSaAyidihi [i. e. I seek protection by Thee from the mischief of the Devil, and his snares]. (TA.)

Xaraku AlT-ariyqi means The main and middle parts of the road; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) syn. jawaAd-uhu: or the tracks that are [conspicuous and distinct,] not obscure to one nor blended together: (Ḳ:) pl. [or rather coll. gen. n.] of XarakapN↓: (Ṣ:) or the OanosaAE of the road; (Aṣ, TA;) i. e. the furrows of the road, made by the beasts with their legs [or feet] in its surface, a Xarakap↓ here and another by the side of it: (TA:) or OaXoraAkN [is its pl., and] signifies the small tracks that branch off from the main road and then stop, or terminate. (Sh, TA.) [See Ous-N.]
XarikN: see XirokN, first sentence.
XarokapN: see XirokN, first sentence.
XurokapN: see XirokN, first sentence.
XirokapN: see XirokN, first sentence.
Also A piece of flesh-meat; of the dial. of El-Yemen; originally, of a slaughtered camel, in which people share, one with another. (TA.)
XarakapN: see XarakN, in six places.
XarikapN: see XirokN, first sentence.

XurakiI-N and Xur-akiI-N A quick, or swift, pace: (Ḳ:) so says ISd. (TA.) And laTomN XurakiI-N A quick and consecutive slapping, (Ṣ, O, Ḳ,) like the camel's slapping when a thorn has entered his foot and he beats the ground with it with a consecutive beating. (Ṣ,* O.) Ows Ibn-Hajar says,
wamaA Oana Uil-aA musotaEid-N kamaA taraI
Oaxuw XurakiI-i Alwirodi gayoru muEat-imi
[And I am none other than one who is ready, as thou seest; one in the habit of quick and consecutive coming to water; not one who is dilatory]: i. e., one coming to water time after time, consecutively: he means, I will do to thee what thou dislikest, not delaying to do that. (Ṣ.)

XiraAkN The thong, or strap, of the sandal, (Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ, TA,) that is on the face thereof, (TA,) upon the back [meaning upper side] of the foot, (Mgh, Mṣb,) [extending from the thong, or strap, that passes between two of the toes, towards the ankle, and having two arms (its EaDudaAni), which are attached to the OucunaAni (q. v.), or pass through these and unite behind the foot: see also xizaAmapN, and faraSahu, whence it appears to mean also each arm, and the two arms, of the XiraAk properly so called: and see xizaAmapN, where it appears to be used as meaning a thong or strap, absolutely:] the XiraAk of the sandal is well known: (O:) pl. XurukN, (O, Ḳ, TA,) and accord. to the Ḳ OaXorukN also, but this is a mistake. (TA.) To this is likened, in a trad., the shadow at the base of a wall, on the eastern side thereof, when very small [or narrow], showing that the sun has begun to decline from the meridian. (Mgh, Mṣb,)

[Hence,] † A streak of herbage: (Ṣ, O, Ḳ:) pl. XurukN, (Ṣ, O, TA,) expl. by AḤn as meaning herbage in streaks; not continuous. (TA.) One says, AlkalaOu fiI baniI fulaAnK XurukN † The herbage among the sons of such a one is composed of streaks. (Aboo-Naṣr, Ṣ, O.)
[In the Ḳ voce banaqa it is used as meaning † A row of shoots, or offsets, cut from palm-trees and planted, such as are termed, when planted, muban-aqN and munab-aqN.]

[Hence,] one says, maDawoA EalaI XiraAkK waAHidK ‡ [They went away in one uniform line or manner]. (TA.) And AijoEali AlOamora XiraAkFA waAHidFA † Make thou the affair, or case, [uniform, or] one uniform thing. (Fr, TA in art. bOj.)

XariykN act. part. n. of XarikapN; (Mgh;) i. q. muXaArikN↓ [A sharer, participator, partaker, or partner, with another; a copartner, an associate, or a colleague, of another]; (Ḳ;) and XirokN↓ signifies the same: (Az, Ḳ, TA:) a sharer in what is not divided: (Ḳ and TḲ in art. xlT:) or a sharer in the rights of a thing that is sold: (Mgh in that art.:) pl. XurakaMCu and OaXoraAkN, (Ṣ, O, Mṣb, Ḳ, TA,) like XurafaMCu and OaXoraAfN pls. of XariyfN; (Ṣ, O, TA;) or the latter is pl. of XirokN↓: (Az, TA:) a woman is termed XariykapN; (Ṣ, O, Ḳ;) which is applied to a man's jaArap [i. e. wife, or object of love]; (TA;) and the pl. of this is XaraAYiku. (Ṣ, O, Ḳ.) Az mentions his having heard one of the Arabs say, fulaAnN Xariyku fulaAnK meaning Such a one is married to the daughter, or to the sister, of such a one; what people call the xatan [of such a one]. (TA.)

muXorikN and muXorikiI-N↓, (Ṣ, O, Ḳ,) like as one says daw-N and daw-iI-N, and qaEosarN and qaEosariI-N, (Ṣ, O,) One who attributes to God a Xariyk [or copartner, &c., or XurakaMC i. e. copartners, &c. (see 4)]: (O:) [i. e. a believer in a duality, or a plurality, of gods:] and [in a wider sense,] a disbeliever [or misbeliever] in God. (Ṣ, O, Ḳ.) Abu-l-ʼAbbás explains [the pl.] muXorikuwna in the Ḳur xvi. 102 as meaning Those who are mXrkwn by their obeying the Devil; by their worshipping God and worshipping with Him the Devil. (TA.)
[In one place, in the CK, the former word is erroneously put for muXotarakN, q. v., last sentence.]
muXorikiI-N: see the next preceding paragraph.

AlfariyDapu AlmuXar-akapu, (O, Ḳ, TA,) or AlmasoOalapu AlmaXar-akapu, (Mṣb,) for AlmuXar-aku fiyhaA, (Mṣb, TA,) is That [assigned portion of inheritance, or the question relating thereto (AlmasoOalapu AlmuXar-akapu being for masoOalapu AlfariyDapi AlmuXar-akapi),] in which the brothers by the mother's side [only] and those by [both] the father's and the mother's sides are made to share together; (O, Mṣb,* Ḳ, TA;) also called AlmuXar-ikapu↓ [that makes to share], tropically; (Mṣb;)
and called also AlmuXotarakapu↓ [for AlmuXotaraku fiyhaA i. e. that is shared in]: (Lth, Ḳ, TA:) this is the case of a husband and a mother and brothers by the mother's side and brothers by the father's and mother's sides: (O, Ḳ, TA:) for the wife is half; and for the mother, a sixth; and for the brothers by the mother's side, a third, and the brothers by the father's and mother's sides share with them: (O, TA:) ʼOmar decided in a case of this kind by assigning the third to two brothers by the mother's side, and not assigning anything to the brothers by the father's and mother's sides; whereupon they said, yaA Oamiyra AlmuWominiyna habo Oan-a OabaAnaA kaAna HimaArFA faOaXorikonaA biqaraAbapi Oum-anaA [O Prince of the Believers, suppose that our father was an ass, and make us to share by reason of the relationship of our mother]: so he made them to share together (faOaXoraka bayonahumo [thus in the O and Ḳ, but correctly faXar-aka bynhm, or, as afterwards in the TA, faXar-akahumo]): (O, Ḳ, TA:) therefore it (i. e. the fariyDap, TA) was called muXar-akap [and muXar-ikap] and muXotarakap, [in the CK, erroneously, muXorakap,] and also HimaAriy-ap: (Ḳ, TA:) and it is also called Hajariy-ap, because it is related that they said, habo Oan-a OabaAnaA kaAna HajarFA muloqFI fiI Alyam-i [suppose that our father was a stone thrown into the sea]; and [therefore] some called it yam-iy-ap: and it was called also Eumariy-ap. (TA. [More is there added, explaining different decisions of this case.])
AlmuXar-ikapu: see the next preceding paragraph.
muXaArikN: see XariykN.
riyHN muXaArikN means A wind to which the nakobaMC [q. v.] is nearer than the two winds between which this blows. (Ḳ.)
muXotarakN, applied to a road (Tariyq, Mgh, Mṣb, TA), is for muXotarakN fiyhi, (Mṣb,) meaning [Shared in: or] in which the people are equal [sharers]. (TA.)

Hence, AlOajiyru AlmuXotaraku [in my copy of the Mgh, erroneously, AlmuXotariku,] The hired man [that is shared in; i. e.,] whose work no one has for himself exclusively of others, but who works for every one who repairs to him for work, like the tailor in the sitting-places of the markets; (Mṣb;) or who works for whom he pleases: as to Oajiyru AlmuXotaraki, it is not right, unless the word thus governed in the gen. case be expl. as an inf. n. (Mgh.)
See also AlfariyDapu AlmuXar-akapu, above.

AisomN muXotarakN [in like manner for muXotarakN fiyhi A noun shared in by several meanings; i. e. a homonym;] a noun shared in by many meanings, such as EayonN and the like: (Mz, 25th nwE; and TA in the present art. and in the Intr.:) or muXotarakN signifies a word having two, or more, meanings; and is applied to a noun, and to the pret. of a verb as denoting predication and prayer, and to the aor. as denoting the present and the future, and to a particle: (Mz ubi suprà:) [muXotarakN used as a subst., meaning a homonym, has for its pl. muXotarakaAtN.]

[AlHis-u AlmuXotaraku, for AlmuXotaraku fiyhi, signifies, in the conventional language of the philosophers, The faculty of fancy; so called because “participated in” by the five senses: but it is vulgarly used as meaning common sense.]

muXotarakN applied to a man, [for muXotarakN fiyhi,] means † Talking to himself, like him who is affected with anxiety; (Aṣ, Ṣ, Ḳ, TA; [in the CK, erroneously, muXorikN;]) his judgment being shared in; not one. (TA.)

hom.sense: 1. Xaramahu, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) aor. _i {yaXorimu}, (Ḳ,) inf. n. XaromN, i. q. Xaq-ahu [meaning He slit it; or rent it; and perhaps also he clave it, split it,, &c.]. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)

It is also said in the Ḳ that AlX-aromu signifies qaToEu maA bayona AlOaronabapi: but mA byn should be struck out: and the passage, moreover, is defective: it should be, as in the M, AlX-aromu and Alt-aXoriymu↓ signify The cutting (qaToE [or rather Xaq- i. e. slitting or rending]) of the end, or tip, of the nose, and of the vafor [here meaning the vulva, or the orifice of the vagina,] of a she-camel: specially said of these two things. (TA. [See also 2; and see XariymN.])
Xarama Alv-ariydapa, aor. and inf. n. as above, and the latter, by poetic license, XaramN, He ate of the sides, or of the edge, of the vrydp [or mess of crumbled bread moistened with broth]. (TA.)
Xarama lahu mino maAlihi, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) aor. as above, (Ḳ,) and so the inf. n., (TA,) He gave him little of his mAl [i. e. property, or cattle]. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)

Xarima, aor. _a {yaXoramu}, is quasi-pass. of Xaramahu; [i. e. it signifies It was, or became, slit, or rent;] (TA;) as also AnXrm↓. (Ṣ, TA. [In the former it is implied that the meaning of the latter verb is AinoXaq-a.])
Also, aor. as above, (Mṣb,) inf. n. XaramN, (Ṣ,* Mṣb, Ḳ,*) He (a man) had his nose slit: (Mṣb:) or he had the end, or tip, of his nose cut. (Ṣ,* Mṣb, Ḳ.*)

entry.sense: 2. taXoriymN i. q. taXoqiyqN [meaning The slitting, or rending, and perhaps also cleaving, splitting,, &c., much, or in several places]: (Ṣ, Ḳ, TA: [see 2 in art. xrm:]) one says, Xr-mhu [he slit it, &c.], in relation to the ear, &c.: (TA:) [it is used in relation to the end, or tip, of the nose; and to the orifice of the vagina of a she-camel; as shown above:] see 1, second sentence. taXoriymu AlZ-iYaAri is [The scarifying of the vulva, or of the orifice of the vagina, for the purpose of] the making a she-camel to affect and suckle a young one not her own [by causing her to imagine, from the pain thus occasioned, that she has recently brought forth that young one]; (TA;) tXrym in this phrase signifying taXoqiyq. (T in art. ZOr.) It is said in a trad. of Ibn-ʼOmar, that he purchased a she-camel, and, seeing in her what is thus termed, returned her: (Ṣ:) in this instance, tXrym AlZYAr means The laceration of the two edges of the vulva on the occasion of ZYAr. (T and TA in art. ZOr: see 1 in that art.)

taXoriymu AlS-ayodi is The wounding of the skin of the animal of the chase without piercing into the belly, or inside, (L in art. Hq, [see 8 in that art.,]) so that the animal escapes wounded. (Ṣ, Ḳ.*)

5. tXr-m, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) said of the skin, (TA,) or of a thing, (Ṣ,) It was, or became, rent, or slit, in several places; (Ṣ, Ḳ, TA;) quasi-pass. of Xar-amahu. (TA.) It is said in a trad. of Kaab, OataI Eumara bikitaAbK qado taXar-amato nawaAHiyhi i. e. taXaq-aqato [meaning He brought to ʼOmar a book of which the sides were slit, or rent, in several places]. (TA.)
7: see 1, near the end.

hom.sense: XaromN A canal, or cut, (xaliyj,) from a baHor [i. e. sea, or large river]: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) [now applied to a creek of a sea:] or the luj-ap [i. e. main body, or fathomless deep,] of the baHor [or sea]: (Ḳ:) or the deepest part thereof: (TA:) or a gamorap [or submerging deep] thereof: pl. XuruwmN. (IB, TA.)
And Any fissure in a mountain or rock, not passing through. (TA.)
Also A certain kind of tree. (Ḳ.)

Also, (Ḳ,) or EuXobN XaromN, (Ṣ, [in one of my copies of the Ṣ XarimN,]) Abundant herbs or herbage, of which the upper parts are eaten, the middle parts not being required, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) nor the lower parts. (Ṣ.)

entry.sense: XaruwmN: see what next follows.

XariymN A woman having her vagina and rectum united by the rending of the separation between them; syn. mufoDaApN; (Ṣ, Mgh, Ḳ;) as also XaruwmN↓, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) and XaromaMCu↓; (Ḳ;) or the last of these in this sense has not been heard, though mentioned in the sense here following. (Mgh.)

Also A she-camel having her vafor [here meaning the vulva, or the orifice of the vagina,] cut [or rather slit or rent]; and so XaromaMCu↓, and maXoruwmapN↓: (M, TA:) or XaromaMCu↓ applied to a she-camel and to a she-ass, accord. to the Tekmileh, means having the vulva slit, or rent: therefore the first-mentioned meaning of this epithet, applied to a woman, if correct, may be tropical. (Mgh.)
Also The faroj [or vulva]; (Ḳ;) because of its being cleft. (TA.)
XaArimN An arrow that slits, or rends, (yaXorimu,) the side of the target. (Ṣ, Ḳ, TA.)

OaXoramu, applied to a man, (IAạr, Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ,) i. q. maXoruwmu↓ AlOanofi; (Ṣ, Ḳ,) [i. e.] Having the nose slit; (IAạr, Mṣb, TA;) like Oaxoramu: (IAạr, TA:) or having the end, or tip, of the nose cut: (Mṣb:) and having the lower lip slit; like OafolaHu: and having the upper lip slit; like OaEolamu: and having the ear slit; like Oaxorabu: and having the eyelid slit; like OaXotaru: it has all these meanings: (IAạr, TA:) fem. XaromaMCu, applied to a woman. (Mṣb.)
For the fem., see also XariymN, in three places.
The fem. is also applied to an ear (OucunN), meaning Having a small portion cut from the upper part; and so muXar-amapN↓. (TA.)

muXar-amN Slit, or rent, in several places: so in a trad., where it is said, fajaMCahu bimuSoHafK muXar-ami AlOaToraAfi [And he brought him a copy of the Ḳur-án having the extremities slit,, &c.]. (TA.)
See also OaXoramu, last sentence.
maXoruwmN: see OaXoramu:
and see also XariymN.
Xaronafotu Alz-aroEa, mentioned under this head in the O and Ḳ: see Q. Q. 4 in art. Xrf. The n is held by Az to be augmentative, if not a mistake for I. (O.)
XironaAfN: see XiroyaAfN, in art. Xrf.

Xariha (Ṣ, MA, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ) EalaI AlT-aEaAmi (MA, Mgh, Mṣb) wagayorihi, (Mṣb,) or UilaI AlT-aEaAmi, (TA, [perhaps a mistranscription,]) aor. _a {yaXorahu}, (Mṣb, Ḳ,) inf. n. XarahN, (Ṣ, MA, Mgh, Mṣb,) said of a man, (Ṣ,) He was vehemently desirous, or greedy; (MA;) or very vehemently desirous, or very greedy; (Mgh, Mṣb;) or overcome by vehement desire, or greediness; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) of the food (MA, Mgh, Mṣb) &c.: (Mṣb:) or, as some say, he was affected with the worst of vehement desire, or of greediness. (TA.)
XarohaAnu: see the next preceding paragraph.

UihoyaA OaXaro UihoyaA, with kesr to the C in AhyA, and with fet-ḥ to the C in AXr, and to the X, (Ḳ, TA,) and with the r quiescent, (TA,) [mentioned in this art. in consequence of the supposing AXr with AhyA after it to compose one word,] but this is not its proper place; (Ḳ, TA;) so says Ṣgh; (TA;) an ancient Greek expression, (Ḳ, TA,) or Syriac, or, more correctly, Hebrew; (TA;) [the truth is that it is a mode of writing the Hebrew words אֶהְיֶה אֲשֶר אֶהְיֶה “I shall be that I am,” in Exod. iii. 14, rendered in our Authorized Version “I am that I am;”] said in prayer; (TA;) [virtually] meaning The existing from eternity, that will not cease to be: (Ḳ:) Ṣgh says, thus one of the learned men of the Jews pronounced it to me in 'Adan Abyan: and some say hyA XrAhyA, as though abridging it, meaning yaA HaI-u yaA qay-uwmu [which may be rendered O Ever-living, O Selfsubsisting by Whom all things subsist; but the latter epithet is variously explained]; so says Lth: (TA:) the people now say OahoyaA XaraAhiyaA, (so in some copies of the Ḳ,) with fet-ḥ to the C in AhyA, and dropping the C in what follows this word, [which, however, probably means that they say OahoyaA Xaro OahoyaA,] or, as in the handwriting of Ṣgh, with medd to the C in the former; (TA;) [in my MṢ. copy of the Ḳ MhiyaA XarAhyA; in the CK, Mhiy-FA XarAhiy-FA;] which is said in the Ḳ to be a mistake accord. to the assertion of the learned men of the Jews: but this, which is said to be a mistake, is what commonly obtains in the books of the people, [i. e. of the Jews,] and they seldom, or never, pronounce it otherwise than thus: Aṣ says that the vulgar say yaA hiyaA, which is post-classical; correctly yaA hayaAha [or yaA hayaA], with fet-ḥ to the C: AḤát says, I think it to be originally yaA hayaA XrAhyA [which is inconsistent with the Hebrew]: and Ibn-Buzurj says, they said yaA hiyaA and yaA hayaA in speaking to one from a near place. (TA.)
XarowN Honey: (Ḳ:) or white honey: mentioned by Ṣgh: formed by transposition from XaworN: (TA:) and also written XirowN↓. (Ḳ.)
XirowN: see what precedes.
XarowaI, originally XaroyaA: see art. XrI.
XirawiI-N, originally XirayiI-N: see art. XrI.

XirowaAlN is [said to be] a dial. var. of sirowaAlN: (Ḳ:) IAmb says that Es-Sijistánee mentions his having heard some of the Arabs of the desert say XirowaAl for sirowaAl; but that it seems he heard them use the Pers. word, [which, it appears, is XarowaAl as well as XalowaAr,] and knew it not: (O, TA:*) XrwAl is a vulgar word, [now commonly pronounced XarowaAl,] and some of the vulgar say XalowaAr, with fet-ḥ to the X. (TA.)

hom.sense: 1. XaraAhu, (Ṣ, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ, &c.,) aor. _i {yaXoriIu}, (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ,) inf. n. XirFI (Ṣ, Mgh, Mṣb, TA) and XiraMCN, (Ṣ,* Mgh, Mṣb,* TA,) the former inf. n. the more in repute, (Mṣb, TA,) and this is of the dial. of Nejd, the latter being of the dial. of El-Ḥijáz, or the latter may be said to be with medd for the purpose of assimilating it to a preceding word, accord. to El-Munádee, or it may be regarded as an inf. n. of XaAraAhu, (TA,) i. q. baAEahu [in the sense in which this is generally used, i. e. He sold it]; (Ṣ, Mgh, Ḳ;) he gave it for a price: (Mṣb:) and i. q. AiXotaraAhu↓ [in the sense in which this is generally used, i. e. he bought it]; (Ṣ, Mgh;) i. e. XaraAhu signifies also he took it, or acquired it, for a price: (Mṣb:) or this and AXtrAh↓ both signify baAEahu [as meaning he sold it]; (T,* Ḳ, TA;) but the former is more used than the latter in this sense: (T, TA:) and both signify also [he bought it; i. e.] he possessed it by sale; (Ḳ;) which is the more usual meaning of the latter: (T, TA:) thus the former has two contr. meanings, (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ,) and the latter also: (Ḳ:) for the two persons selling and buying sell and buy the price and the thing upon which the price is put; so that each of the things given in exchange is sold in one point of view and bought in another. (Mṣb, TA.) It is said in the Ḳur [ii. 203], wamina Qln-aAsi mano yaXoriI nafosahu QbotigaMCa maroDaApi Qll-ehi i. e. [And of men is he] who sells [himself in the endeavour to obtain the approval of God]. (Ṣ,* TA.) And in the same, [xii. 20], waXarawohu bivamanK baxosK i. e. And they sold him [for a deficient, or an insufficient, price]. (Ṣ, TA.) And in the same [ii. 15], OuwlaAYika Ql-aciyna QXotarawuA↓ QlD-alaAlapa biQlohudaI, originally QXotarayuwA, (Ṣ,) [lit. Those are they who have purchased error with right direction,] meaning, ‡ who have taken AlDlAlp in exchange for AlhdI: (Ksh, Bḍ, Jel:) or ‡ who have preferred AlDlAlp to AlhdI: (Ksh, Bḍ:) [for] of any one who relinquishes a thing and lays hold upon another thing, one says AXtrAh; (Ḳ, TA;) which is thus tropically used [as meaning ‡ he took it in exchange bigayorihi by giving up another thing]; (TA;) and hence this saying in the Ḳur-án. (Ḳ, TA.)

[Hence,] XaraI binafosihi Eani Alqawomi ‡ He advanced before the people, or party, (Ḳ, TA,) to their enemy, (TA,) and fought in defence of them: or ‡ he advanced to the Sultán, and spoke for the people: (Ḳ, TA:) [as though he sold himself for them; the b in bnfsh being app. redundant:] or, as in the Tekmileh, XaraI binafosihi UilaI Alqawomi ‡ he advanced to the people, or party, and fought them. (TA.)

And XaraI fulaAnFA, (Ḳ,) inf. n. XirFI, (TA,) † He mocked at, scoffed at, laughed at, derided, or ridiculed, such a one: (Ḳ:) [and] so Xar-aAhu↓. (TA voce jad-aEahu [q. v.: thus there written, perhaps for the purpose of assimilating it to jad-aEahu].)

And i. q. Oarogamahu † [He angered such a one; or did evil to him, and angered him]: (Lḥ, Ḳ, TA:) and so Oaworamahu, and gaTaAhu [or perhaps EaZaAhu, for both are expl. alike]: all said of God. (Lḥ, TA.) And faEala bihi maA XaraAhu † He did to him that which occasioned evil to him; or that which displeased, grieved, or vexed, him; syn. saMCahu. (TA.) And laHaAhu Qll-ehu waXaraAhu † [May God remove him far from good or prosperity, or curse him, and do evil to him, or displease or grieve or vex him]. (TA.)
XaraI Qll-ehu fulaAnFA, (Ḳ,) inf. n. XirFI, (TA,) also signifies God smote him, or may God smite him, with the eruption termed XarFI [q. v.]. (Ḳ, TA.)

And XaraAhu, (Ḳ,) aor. _i {yaXoriIu}, inf. n. XirFI, (TA,) i. q. Xar-arahu, (Ḳ, TA,) i. e. He spread it [to dry]; (TA;) [in copies of the Ḳ, in art. Xr, written, in this sense, Xar-aAhu↓;] namely, flesh-meat, and a garment, or piece of cloth, and [the preparation of curd called] OaqiT. (Ḳ.)

XariIa, aor. _a {yaXoraIu}, inf. n. XarFI, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) said of lightning, (Ṣ, Ḳ, &c.,) It shone, or gleamed, much: (Ṣ:) or it shone, or gleamed, (Ḳ, TA,) and spread in the face of the clouds, or, as in the T, became dispersed in the face of the clouds: (TA:) and AXrI↓ signifies the same; (Ḳ;) or it shone, or gleamed, consecutively: the latter verb mentioned by Ṣgh. (TA.)
And hence, (Ṣ,) said of the nose-rein of a camel, (Ṣ, TA,) It was, or became, in a state of commotion, (TA,) or, of much commotion. (Ṣ, TA. [See also 12.])
Also, (Ḳ,) aor. and inf. n. as above, (TA,) He (a man) was, or became, angry: (Ḳ, TA:) or he was, or became, flurried by reason of anger. (Ṣ, TA.)
And, said of evil, or mischief, It spread, bayonahumo among them: (Ḳ, TA:) or became great, or formidable; and in like manner said of an affair, or event. (Nh, TA. [See also 10.])

Also, and AstXrI↓, He (a man, Ṣ) persisted, or persevered, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) in an affair, (Ṣ,) or in his error, and his corrupt conduct: and the former, said of a man, is like gariIa in measure and meaning [i. e. he persisted, or persevered, in his anger]. (TA.) One says of a horse, XariIa fiI sayorihi, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) inf. n. as above, (TA,) He persisted, or persevered, in his pace, or going;
as also AstXrI↓: (Ṣ:) or he exceeded the usual bounds therein, (Ḳ, TA,) and went on without languor: (TA:) and AstXrI↓ fiI Eadowihi he (i. e. a horse) persisted, or persevered, in his running: (Mgh:) and XariIa fiI lijaAmihi he (a horse) strained his bridle. (A, TA.) And Xariyato Eayonuhu biAld-amoEi His eye persisted, or persevered, in the shedding of tears, the tears pouring forth consecutively. (TA.)
And XariIa, (Ṣ, Ḳ, TA,) aor. _a {yaXoraIu}, inf. n. XarFI, (Ḳ,* TA,) He, (TA,) or his skin, broke out with the eruption termed XarFI [q. v.]. (Ṣ, Ḳ, TA.)

entry.sense: 2: see the preceding paragraph {1}, in two places.

3. XaAraAhu, inf. n. muXaAraApN and XiraMCN, i. q. baAyaEahu [as signifying He sold and bought with him: and he bartered, or exchanged commodities, with him: that XArAh has both of these meanings (like bAyEh) is shown by the fact that muXaAraApN is also expl. in the TA, on the authority of Er-Rághib, as signifying the same as qibaADN]. (Ḳ.)

Also, (Mgh,) inf. n. muXaAraApN, (TA,) He persisted in contention, litigation, or wrangling: (Mgh:) one says, huwa yuXaAriyhi (T, M, Ḳ) He persists in contention, litigation, or wrangling, with him: (M, TA:) or he contends in altercation, disputes, or litigates, with him; or does so vehemently, or obstinately; syn. yujaAdiluhu: (Ḳ, TA:) and it is said of the Prophet, in a trad., kaAna laA yuXaAriI walaA yumaAriI [He used not to persist in contention,, &c.]: (Mgh, TA:) meaning accord. to Th, kaAna laA yasotaXoriI↓ biAlX-ar-i [he used not to persist, or persevere, with evil conduct]: (TA:) from AisotaXoraI fiI Eadowihi [expl. above (see 1 near the end)] as said of a horse: (Mgh:) or, accord. to Az, (TA,) originally yuXaAriru; one of the r s being changed into I. (Ḳ,* TA. [See 3 in art. Xr: and see also 3 in art. jrI.])

hom.sense: 4. AXrI, said of lightning: see 1, latter half.
Said of a camel, He sped, or went quickly. (IḲṭṭ, TA.)
AXrI bayonahumo He excited discord, strife, or animosity, between them, or among them. (Az, Ḳ.)

AXrI AlHamalu (Ḳ accord. to the CK, [which, I think, evidently gives the right reading,] in the TA and in my MṢ. copy of the Ḳ Aljml,) i. q. tafal-aqato Eaqiyqatuhu [i. e. The lamb had its wool cleaving open, or becoming cleft]: (Ḳ: [Freytag, following the TḲ, and reading AlHimolu, explains the verb as said of fruit, and meaning “diffissos habuit nucleos;” but I cannot find any authority for the signification that he thus assigns to Eaqyqp:]) mentioned by Ṣgh. (TA.)
AXrt AlX-ajarapu The plant [crept upon the ground, or] was like the cucumber and the melon; as also AstXrt↓. (TA.)
See also 5.
AXrAhu He filled it; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) namely, a watering-trough: and in like manner AXrI jafonapF he filled a bowl, (Ṣ,) or jifaAnahu his bowls for the guests. (TA.)

And He made it to incline, (Ḳ, TA,) fiI naAHiyapi kacaA [in the direction of such a thing]. (TA.) Hence the saying of a poet,
waOan-aniI HayovumaA yuXoriI AlhawaI baSariI
mino HawovamaA salakuwA Oadonuw faOanoZuwru
[And that I, wherever love makes my eye, or eyes, to incline, wherever they travel, approach and look: fAnZwr being for faOanoZuru]: or, as some relate it, OavoniI faOanoZuwru [i. e. turn myself, or my eyes, and look]. (TA.)
[Also He put it in motion; namely, a bridle. (Freytag, from the Deewán of the Hudhalees.)]

entry.sense: 5. tXr-I It became scattered, or dispersed: (Ḳ:) accord. to the M, said in this sense of a company of men. (TA.)
Also, said of a man, (Ṣ,) or of a party, or company of men, (TA,) He, or they, became like the XuraAp [pl. of XaArK q. v.] in his, or their, actions; (Ṣ,* TA;) and so AXrI↓. (IAth, TA.)
6. taXaArayaA They sued each other; or cited each other before a judge; syn. taqaADayaA. (A, TA.)
8: see the first paragraph {1}, in three places.
10. AstXrI: see 1, latter part, in three places: and see 1.
Also He persisted, or persevered, in consideration, or examination. (TA.)
And AstXrI fiI diynihi He strove, or exerted himself, or was diligent, or studious, and was careful, or mindful, or regardful, in his religion. (TA.)
And AstXrt AlOumuwru bayonahumo The affairs, or events, were, or became, great, or formidable, between them, or among them. (Ḳ,* TA. [See also XariIa.])
And see 4.
12. AiXoraworaI It was, or became, in a state of commotion. (Ḳ. [See also XariIa.])

hom.sense: XaroIN The colocynth: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) or it signifies, (Ḳ,) or signifies also, (Ṣ,) the plant thereof: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) n. un. with p {XaroIapN}: (Ṣ:) and XaroyaAnN↓ also signifies the colocynth; as a dial. var. of XaroIN: or the leaves thereof. (TA.) One says, huwa OaHolaI mina AlOaroIi waOamar-u mina AlX-aroIi [He, or it, is sweeter than honey and more bitter than colocynth]. (TA.) And fulaAnN lahu TaEomaAni OaroIN waXaroIN [Such a one has two flavours, that of honey and that of colocynth]. (Ṣ, TA.)
And Any kind of plant that spreads upon the ground, running [or creeping] and extending; such as the melon and the cucumber. (AḤn, O voce suT-aAHN, q. v., and TA * in the present art.)
And Palm-trees that grow from the datestones: (Ḳ:) and with p {XaroIapN} [as the n. un.] one of such palm-trees. (Ṣ.)
And, accord. to IJ, A kind of tree of which bows are made. (L voce Hat-N, q. v. [See also XiroyaAnN.])
See also XarFI.
And see XarowaI.

XarFI A road, (Ḳ, TA,) in a general sense. (TA.) And, (Ḳ,) with the article Al, [particularly] A road of Selmà, (Ṣ, Ḳ, TA,) the mountain so called, (TA,) abounding with lions: (Ṣ, Ḳ, TA:) whence they say of courageous men, maA humo Uil-aA Ousuwdu AlX-araI [They are no other than the lions of Esh-Sharà]. (TA.)

And i. q. naAHiyapN [as meaning An adjacent tract or region]; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) as also XaraMCN↓: (Ḳ:) accord. to some, of the right hand: (TA:) pl. OaXoraMCN. (Ṣ, Ḳ.) Hence, XaraI AlfuraAti The adjacent tract (naAHiyap) of the Euphrates: (TA:) and OaXoraMCu AlHarami the adjacent tracts of the Sacred Territory; syn. nawaAHiyhi. (Ṣ.)
And A mountain. (Ḳ.)

Also The bad, or worse, or worst, of cattle: accord. to J, [in the Ṣ,] XaroIN↓, [said in the Ṣ to be like XawaI AlmaAli,] which is [said to be] a mistake: (Ḳ:) but El-Bedr El-Karáfee questions it being so: (TA:) and the good, or better, or best, thereof; as also XaraApN↓: thus having two contr. significations: (Ḳ:) and so says ISk: but ISd says that UibilN XaraApN↓, like saraApN, means choice camels. (TA.)
